name: Governor's Island
description: One of the most popular stops, featuring a viewing deck with a panoramic view of the park, a zipline connecting to Virgin Island, and the famous 'Big Brother' house.

name: Quezon Island
description: The most developed island in the park, serving as the main activity hub. It offers dining pavilions, snorkeling gear rentals, and kayaking facilities.

name: Marcos Island
description: Famous for the Imelda Cave, which features a natural pool accessible by a thrilling cliff jump. It also has a fine white sand beach.

name: Pilgrimage Island
description: Formerly known as Martha Island, this spot features a giant statue of Christ the Savior. Visitors climb approximately 263 steps to reach the shrine.

name: Children's Island
description: Known for its shallow, calm waters ideal for young swimmers. It offers designated camping areas and a more relaxed atmosphere compared to Quezon Island.
